comment: Professor Shade was responsive to my emails whenever I had questions. Sometimes the assignment instructions were unclear, but they were fine overall. The quizzes are not too difficult, and there is a midterm and final. Finally, there are some discussions which are easy points.

All you have to do is read. This class was not hard at all the only hard thing was getting in contact with her sometimes. When I did get in contact with her she was super sweet and she helped me with everything I needed. She's seriously so nice. The instructions were clear, textbook had everything you needed so get the book.

Take this class if you have critical thinking skills. I swear it's not as hard as everyone makes it seem. Literally just read... Everything you need is in the textbook, w3schools or D2L. The class is extremely easy, her only flaw is that she is a terrible communicator. Don't ask last minute questions and stay on top of things... easy A.

You will be teaching yourself. Don't expect her to help you or give you good feedback. It also takes her long to grade. She is one of those teachers that will take off points for the smallest things that aren't explicitly stated in the instructions. I recommend using Ai to do your assignments. she gives alot of assignments. she cant detect ai.

This teacher was terrible. Her course load was very unorganized and heavy. Hard Grading. Gave a lot of projects that were very vague ,received bad grades. Passive aggressive in her emails. Online tests. Some students had webcam, some didnt. She's given me wrong information about tests and assignments twice that ended caused me to get bad grades.

Professor Shade is quite the harsh teacher, with 45% of your grade based on her weekly assignments. She does not teach the material; it is a self-taught course with minimal teacher engagement. She will take 3-4 weeks to grade each assignment and mark off points for items not listed in her requirements. She is one of the few options, so be cautious.

She gives a lot of assignments and group work even though it's a fully online class that never meets. There is always something due every week. The PowerPoint slides she provides do not help with the quizzes or exams at all. No lectures are posted so it is very hard to study. She expects you to be an expert in excel.

I took Professor Shade for Information System Communications. The class had tons of work that she did not keep up with grading. She did not provide a single lecture. The content was not organized. This class was very frustrating. I would not recommend spending your hard-earned money on what she had to offer.

Only reason I passed this class is already having HTML knowledge. She doesn't post things as "assignments" so you really have to check every day to see if something is due. You have to upload assignments to your webpage you make. She was nice any time I emailed her. Responded fairly quickly. Tough grader and no late work AT ALL.

2 stars is on the brighter side. Shes a fair grader and thats about all the upside. Terrible communicator, takes FOREVER to grade things, poor direction on assignments. However, shes one of the only options. You wont enjoy the class but youll survive it with ease. Just take it and get it over with.

Ive never wanted to kms in a class more. Her directions are god awful and sometimes arent even full sentences. I took the online summer section and she never responded to students in a timely manner. She also posts a 40 minute video tutorial that could be ten minutes and rambles for half of it and expects you to follow along.

The only teacher for IS3260 but it isn't a hard class. I took online so I was able to do the assignments as they opened up. I had previous experience with HTML so it was an easy class for me. There is a semester project start it sooner than later it is a lot of work but not hard to complete.

No. Just no. I've taken her twice now and she just isn't a professor that seems invested in the success or wellbeing of her students. She doesn't do a lot of teaching herself (at least in her online classes), instead relying on textbook reading to teach us instead. The group project is a mess and she seems annoyed when you ask for assignment help.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Group projects

comment: Before taking this class, I was weary of Shade. However, she is really caring and willing to help. Just do your work and pay attention. The content is fairly easy, and she gives you all the code needed to do all homework and exams. I am excited about taking her for capstone! Read the book bc it helps alot on exams and quizzes!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Caring

comment: If u miss the class, even if you don't pay attention in the class, it could be the hardiest class ever. but overall, she is not the worst. However, she could give students better lecture. her lecture is mostly going over the coding. She could give us more organized grade, and faster feed back. I want to kno how I did on my hw to study for the test
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy

comment: Horrible. Maybe it's just because I'm taking this class as an online summer course but it's been awful. We don't have nearly enough time to finish all the assignments. It's the last week and she has just now started to put in our grades so we don't have any idea where we are at in the class. Don't recommend at least for a summer course.

Prof. Shade is awesome. She is direct and only goes over what is needed. Capstone is a lot of work, as it should be. But, she is there whenever you need her for help or feedback. I couldn't imagine any other professor teaching this course, she is very dedicated to helping students. I learned more from her than any other professor.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: This prof has been one of the worst, we could literally build a discord bot that does more than her, I am creating an incident report and presenting it to the IS chair. Anyone willing to come forth as testimony this professor shouldn't be "teaching" This concept is very easy and she is making it sound like the most complicated thing ever.

Absolutely awful, she has made a very very very easy subject hard to understand, she might as well make half her class TAs bc she doesn't do anything and reuses the same material over and over again so much she mixes her class assignments.
rating_tags: LOTS OF HOMEWORK--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: Sherri shade is the worst professor Ive ever taken. Gives directions that are impossible to follow. Posts announcements that contradict each other. Doesnt clarify anything when you email her, just repeats what you emailed her about. Gives long projects that build on each other. 10/10 wouldnt recommend. All I got out of this class was a headache
rating_tags: Get ready to read--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: Unless you like a professor who gives ambiguous instructions and can't explain them, don't take sherri shade. Gives multiple projects with horrible directions that are almost impossible to follow but the quizzes are easy. Email her for clarification and she will refer you back to the original instructions that you told her couldn't understand.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: If you're a fan of showing up to class and following along everything she types this class is for you. She is disorganized, lazy and unmotivated to teach. God forbid you email her with any questions don't hold your breath on a response. Make sure you show up everyday miss a class its like you're behind the whole semester. Wish KSU had more teachers
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Quizzes are easy enough but the projects and exams are borderline ridiculous. 30 minutes for midterm when there's 52 questions? Her response for the amount of time being it takes her that long to answer questions so we should be able to answer in that time frame as well. Do not recommend her to anyone. Also gives projects not related to the course.

Professor Shade really wants her students to do well in the course. Her instructions are vague but if you email her to clarify she will and that helped me. Lots of assignments and quizzes start early. Study for the final/midterm because there is no time to look up answers. Get with a group for the group project because it is a lot of work.

Took online for IS 2200 shes a great professor. I took her class over the summer and we had a lot of assignments, and quizzes and a big group project but they are all doable. I guess I did well because even when instructions are vague just email her and ask to clarify. The assignments are not hard just time consuming so don't wait to do them.

I took her online class. She gives a lot of work. Each week there were online quizzes and assignments. She gave detailed instructions for assignments. If you follow the instructions for the assignments, you will get a good grade. I would recommend taking this professor because she grades fairly and lets you know everything you need to do.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: Not horrible, but be warned! Does not teach at all, expects you to know many things from classes you might not have taken yet. Expects you to have high level of proficiency in technology. Gets mad when you ask questions. Will hold a grudge. But at the end of the day, if you work hard, it will be fine.

Professor Shade is there for a paycheck. There is no passion in her lectures, and do not expect much help from her in or out of class. There are a LOT of assignments (sometimes 3 or more in a week) and quizzes/projects often require book use. Class material is interesting enough. The overall experience was underwhelming but just barely acceptable.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: Try to get in contact with her and she gets upset. GO FIGURE!
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: She has got to be the worst professor in ANY university system in America. Honestly terrible... im not even saying this cuz she screwed me over, cuz I got an A in her class... but shes just a terrible terrible person. she makes fun of her students.. is extremely sarcastic.. and DOESNT EXPLAIN ANYTHING!!!!

Better for web dev than app dev. She basically shows you and you copy it. You have assignments (easy) and quizzes (12 mins to do 10 probs/not on google, a group paper,group project and presentation, and midterm and final. The exams are difficult and come from random parts of the book. Pick a good group bc its a majority of your grade.

IS 3260 - Web Development Her class is very good. She goes over it in class even though you have a book and tons of material online to learn the information. I wouldn't miss to many classes and she grades based on what you do in class. Her feedback is wonderful and compliment what you learn. You get to create a website for a company, really cool.

Terrible.  Took her online and the projects were significantly more detailed than people in other IS 2200 online classes.  Her instructions were outdated (referencing Netscape as the browser of choice), making the already detailed projects more difficult.  Oh and a 12 page firm analysis.  However, she grades pretty lightly.  Take someone else.

She is disruptive during student presentations and can be rude in response to student's questions. Just for an example, one day in class she said (referring to D2L), "Why would you look in 'Grades' to see your grades?" She is an IS professor and can't even figure out D2L, she is always having difficulties with the system.

Shade is my online IS professor and she is one of my least favorite professors I've had. Never answers emails and if she does they are just vague responses in mass emails to the entire class that still don't answer your question. Takes forever to grade as well. Ive been waiting for a month to get a grade on a big assignment we had.

She can be described in 1 word: awful! Goes over stuff way to fast. Don't ask questions, because she doesn't like to repeat herself and is very snarky with responses. Also, she just assigns assignments just depending on if she feels like it, regardless if you have learned it yet. Makes assignments harder than has to be. AVOID AT ALL COST!

Shade told us on day 1 many don't drop this class. The assignments and group project carry most of the weight in this class - NOT exams. Exams were not easy - I made an 82 on the midterm & 70 on the final. However, the semester project was 35% of the total grade so I still got an A. Put in the work and you can get the grade you want. GET THE BOOK!

ATTENTION STUDENTS WITH WORK ETHIC - do not be taunted by the negative reviews. I didn't want to take Shade because I had NO app experience. However, I did well (high A). We had 1 exam. Logicflowcharting, no code. Ask questions, study, go to class & choose a good partner for the project. You will be fine. Only complaint - she's a VERY slow grader.

Worst professor ever. Runs through coding, so over half the class can't keep up. I didn't have a problem here, but she takes FOREVER to grade assignments. So you don't even know if you are doing it right until after the final presentation when she starts grading it. AVOID! I passed, but she is terrible. She was late to class all the time.

Teaches by example; only problem, she likes to taunt students by running through it as FAST as possible.  Most of her teaching is through YouTube links. I paid for that?!?!  Received 1st grades on 115, months after they were done. No chance to learn and correct mistakes on future assignments.  On 129, 75% of my grade still undetermined!#LAZYWITCH

I don't know how this lady is still teaching at Kennesaw. It is even more ridiculous that you HAVE to take her for Web Dev and Capstone. She does not grade on time, does not explain material adequately, and is extremely unforgiving of any absences or what she considers "stupid questions."

You will leave this class asking, Prof Shade, Why are you teaching? Love KSU, but Prof Shade is the most unprofessional, uninspired professor. She is teaching out-of-date methodology and unused technology. Extremely unorganized, does not grade assignments on time and grades incorrectly. AVOID this individual, you will not learn  or enjoy.

I LOVED Professor Shade. It was a tough class and it moved at a fast pace. Choose a good group to work with and pair up with someone that can help you learn the material. She is willing to help and slow down for those who do not understand though. Don't be afraid to ask questions. She will stop to help! Buy the book and read it!

One of the hardest professors I've ever taken classes with at KSU. She is highly knowledgeable but teaches very fast. Is either pay attention in class or type on the computer. She takes for EVER to grade. Horrible professor!!! Won't take her again.

Honestly don't make the same mistake I did taking her after I read all the prior comments. Not only is she disrespectful but rude and a horrible teacher. Subjective grading and the kind of person who is always right when clearly shes wrong. Tests are graded lousy.

A horrible course, nice person, knows a ton of stuff. Over worked or shes horrible with people. She moves so fast, I couldn't watch her while doing the steps on my screen. Course jumps around in the book. Spent no class time directing students, zero. She got irritated easily. This course needs a new designer, its for beginners but taught for pros.

I think the issue with this professor is that she teaches too many classes at once. She takes forever to grade, hard to get in touch with, harshly takes points off for things outside rubric, teaches way too fast, occassionally spends 20mins trying to get students caught up. I'm a dean's/president's list student, and Ive made B's in all her classes.

Teaches all the Web Dev. Classes. She is decent with Web Dev. because she has experience, but she is awful in Data Management and IT Infrastructure, because she doesn't actually know the material.  She's often late, waits until finals week to grade many things. Lectures often does not relate to tests Does not review or further explain concepts.

Don't take her for database management.She is good at webdev but not database.Does not grade anything on time.Doesn't grade first assignments before withdrawl date.Seems like she doesn't even know/understand project requirements. Has a bad habit of saying that she said/went over something in class when she never did/contradicting herself.

Unfortunately for KSU, Shade teaches most of the IS courses, and there's no way to avoid her. She is an awful instructor, late to class, late to grade, class material can be confusing and not directed. And if your taking Database you may want to buy another book for Access, because she gives you almost nothing, and its the main project.
She's not very nice and fairly rude to people. Works at a fast pace and hates explaining things twice. Tests are easy, project is elementary. Easy class if you can tolerate the professor

She teaches very fast and doesn't like to slow down for people who can't keep up. She knows what she is talking about to a degree but if anyone corrects her she doesn't like it. Very boring class and not good for people who have never used dreamweaver before.

Loved the course! Professor Shade is intense but keeps the material interesting. Thanks to her I learned how to develop a website, code html, and code in CSS, within 8 days. Would take her again, Awesome professor with real world experience.

She is the worst teacher in KSU. She teaches everything so FAST. she acts like we knew how to build webpage the minute we were born. Doesn't grade work on time, she gets mad if we correct her in class, careless in checking work, doesn't respond to emails on time. "THE WORST PROFESSOR." If you are still reading this then Good Luck taking her class!

I had her for Intro to IS and Web Dev 1. You'll hate her in the intro because it's boring, but she's much more involved and you learn more in Web Dev 1. It really depends on the class, but she's a solid professor who really knows her stuff. For Web Dev 1, the semester project where you build an entire website is a bit overwhelming though.
Had her for web dev 1. Useless busy work. Does not condones those who knows more than her. Gets mad easily. Do not take her.

Terrible professor teaching out of date technology. Extremely unorganized, does not grade anything on time. She also believes she knows a lot about web development but she is only fooling herself. Recommend a different professor.

Very disorganized, takes forever to grade work, and speaks in a sleep-inducing, monotone voice. Maybe 3-4 class days were interesting, but otherwise, it's pretty boring. I wouldn't die if I had to take her again, but I'm definitely avoiding her classes and don't recommend them to my friends.

I took Ms. Shade for Web Design I and ended up with quite a surprising grade at the end of the term. She doesn't hand back assignments promptly, is NOT clear on what she requires of you, especially on the term project, and seems rather apathetic to her students. This class is basically a really long Dreamweaver tutorial. Avoid as an elective.

Prof. knows her stuff. Very informative class. Loved it. I used book. Not much note taking, mostly hands on, which is what I like.  Only had one test so far, was online test. I thought it was great, but I love working with computers. I would take her again!

I actually like her a lot. She can come off as smart-alecky and rude, but overall she's pretty nice. Took her for WebDev I and IT Infrastructure, and the assignments are pretty easy for both classes, with not too much busy work. Didn't use the book in WebDev, but used it a bit in IT. Also had a group project and presentation in both classes.
Unpredictable. Doesn't seem to care about in class material and very harsh grader.  Slow to grade anything.  Ancient material.  Sadly, one of the best KSU IS professors, a sad thing to say.

Maymester Web Dev.  She really knows her stuff, very helpful.  Very specific on what is required, somewhat tough grader. Very fond of group projects.  Online tests challenging, in-class tests allows a cheat sheet!  Highly recommended!

She knows her stuff and is very direct. I didn't think she was rude at all but instead expects her students to be at a college level of learning... imagine that. Her door was always open for any extra time or help that was needed. Good job Sherri.
Taught shade was a pretty decent teacher.. the class was easy to me. I rather have teacher who has some experience than one who doesn't know an apple from an orange.

Worst class I have taken at KSU!!! Need to know HTML coding and others before taking this class if you are to keep up...ironically, this is what the class is supposed to teach. Professor has no patience, is rude and has her favorites (those from her previous class).

Agree with previous comments that she can be quite terse and unforgiving.  Attendance not mandatory but missing a single day of class can put you very far behind.  Group project will be frustrating because your groupmates will inevitably be useless slackers.  She knows the subject very well though.

I'm not sure what I got out of this class other than Ms. Shade is rude, condescending and is annoyed if you can't keep up in class. It is easy to fall behind if you don't already know the code or Dreamweaver.  Too much is crammed into this class. She is consistently late to class also. Positive--she knows her stuff.

There is a sharp contrast between what is taught in lecture in this class and the assignments given. The project literally had nothing to do with the content in the book. This class is in need of extreme revision or removal.

Seems to be annoyed by her responsibilities as a professor. No response to e-mails, poor use of vista modules, has a mean streak and likes to give condescending responses to student questions. If you have another choice, I would go with it. On the plus side, she knows what she's talking about and makes good use of class time.

Worst prof I have had at KSU.  Took off class time in Maymester to go to graduation one night and her kid's band concert the next.  And it's a Maymester class, but she gave assignments due a month after class ended.  Final exam was a joke.  Didn't give any grades until after the withdraw date.  Avoid at all costs.

I like Mrs. Shade, though a lot of my classmates don't.  In my opinion if you just apply yourself a little bit and don't ask stupid questions, you shouldn't have a problem.  I never even used the textbook for this course (though I was already very familiar with the subject that was being taught).  Only bad thing was a lack of feedback on homework.

I've taken Shade for a few classes now and I rather like her.  She understands that people have jobs outside of the class and trys to make the most of the class time.  I think she's very fair with her work, but she does lack feedback on homework assignments.  I would take another class with her again.

Obviously the first time she taught this class.  Assignments in class were helpful, but graded assignments were thrown together last minute. We had no idea what grades we were getting and had no feedback until the last week of class. I made an A, but had no idea until the final day grades were due. But your only option for Web Dev.So have fun

Nice person, but lacks relevant or real world experience. Gives zero feedback regarding grades. 1 exam, 1 final all semester each with 80+ questions covering too many chapters. Admitted it was bad herself. Assignments are weak. Looking forward to a professor that keeps learning instead of just collecting a check, but this isn't it. 3/10
AVOID....  Walking Attitude. Most in my class were not happy with our experience. Learning outcome was poor. Try Jorge Perez instead if he is available.
Online Class, laid out very well and has been easy to follow. Not as involved in daily communication as a lot of online professors, but very helpful and responsive.

Nice lady, but she acted as if everyone in the class knew HTML; if I did I wouldn't have taken the class.I tried very hard and still got a C. If you don't have a foundation in HTML before taking her class don't even bother.
Don't buy book,never even used it. She uses power point. Hard class if you dont know anything about websign.

"She really sucked. Really bad. HORRIBLE!!!!! Unless you already know EVERYTHING, dont take her or you will not do well at all."                                                                            Agreed!!!!!!!!!
Online Course, the only contact we had was through email (very sparse) and the initial posting of the material. Did not answer general questions posted to the forums.

She tends to be very condescending, and her teaching style is intimidating, especially to new web designers.  Even as a self-taught webmaster, it was difficult passing her class.  Her tests are too hard and the workload is absurd for the final project.  Avoid her if you can.

Took online CSIS 2300.  Why was there a teacher?  The assignments, quizzes, labs, and exams were automated and straight from the company that printed the textbook.  I suppose somebody was needed to keypunch in the grades, but this teacher was a fifth wheel.  Zero discussion board interaction & borderline rude email responses.  She phoned it in.

Slow on grading or returning work. she teaches from powerpoint. all of the quizzes and labs are done online. she seems nice and tries to answer people's questions, but i would not suggest taking her class due to her teaching style.if you take her, remember to do the online labs/quizes and make good notecards for the tests.
She really sucked. Really bad. HORRIBLE!!!!!  Unless you already know EVERYTHING, dont take her or you will not do well at all.
Alot of work with the labs and quiz. I took during the summer so there were 2 of each due each week but if you keep up you should get an A or B.

I really digged Mrs.Shade, she's a cool prof, unless you're a nerd or slacker, then maybe you might not like her.  She's tight.  I'd take another class with her any day of the week.  Not demanding, coursework is light and easy, please people!

HORRIBLE ! She is very snotty in her responses in emails, very unclear, not helpful, unresponsive.  Avoid her.  While i did ok in the class, I do not want to take her again, i really dislike the attitude she putsforth in her email responses.
I really enjoyed the online class.

She doesn't not communicate with her students in the online courses. I sent her many e-mails trying to speak with her. She never responded once. Even though I'm doing well in the course I do not recomend her, for the online course. She creates strict guildlines that are hard at times. I'm displeased with how this teacher conducted herself.
Great teacher, use xtra credit to your advantage!!
Knows what she is talking about
